revised_title: Structural Features and Movements in Leaves: A Study of Nyctitropism and Concussion-Induced Movements
tldr: The author examines the relationship between the structural features of certain leaves and the phenomena of nyctitropism and movements caused by concussion. The study focuses on the contractile organs and their structural arrangements, which facilitate the redistribution of fluids in the tissues, influencing the extent and rapidity of the movements. The findings suggest that the structural features play a crucial role in determining the occurrence and characteristics of these movements.
